tank.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a large container for storing liquid or gas
petrol tank British English,  gas tank American English
tank.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Somehow the chemical got from a storage tank into water supplies.
tank.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: the amount of liquid or gas held in a tank
tank.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: We set off next day on a full tank.
tank.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a heavy military vehicle that has a large gun and runs on two metal belts fitted over its wheels
tank.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: a large artificial pool for storing water
tank.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to decrease quickly or be very unsuccessful
tank.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Not long after the chairman resigned, shares in the company tanked.
tank.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to travel very fast in a car or vehicle
tank.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: to fail badly and be very unsuccessful
tank.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: His last film tanked in the States, but did well in the UK.
tank.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: to deliberately lose a sports game that you could have won
tank.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: likely to fail and lose money
tank.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: With the junk-bond market in the tank, smarter investors are trying to pick up other investments
Sales can’t keep going up at that rate, but that doesn’t mean the industry is going in the tank.
